name: Where Did That Come From? Quiz | World | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where is the story "Espumas Flutuantes" from?
questions.explanation:
Brazil.

	Castro Alves was a Brazilian poet who wrote "Espumas Flutuantes" in 1870. After his death at age twenty-four, he became known as the major poet of his times and one of the main poets of Brazilian national literature.

questions.text: The stories "The Lion, The Witch and The Wardrobe" and "An Ideal Husband" were written in what country?
questions.explanation:
England.

	Irish born C.S. Lewis wrote "The Lion, The Witch and the Wardrobe" while working as a professor at Oxford. The book is the second of the "Chronicles of Narnia" series. Oscar Wilde established himself as a playwright with such plays like "An Ideal Husband" (1895).

questions.text: From which country do the Brothers' Grimm "Fairy Tales" come?
questions.explanation:
Germany.

	Jacob Ludwig Karl Grimm (1785-1863) and Wilhelm Karl Grimm (1786-1859) are famous for their collection of "Fairy Stories" published in two volumes in 1812 and 1814 respectively. They collected the stories from forty different people. Most of the stories are essentially folk-tales for adults and some are gruesome and not necessarily suitable for children.

questions.text: In what country were "Iliad" and "Helen" written?
questions.explanation:
Greece.

	Homer started writing "Illiad" in BC 750 and finished in BC 725. It is the story of the Trojan War. Isocrates wrote "Helen" in BC 370 to BC 392. It is made up of 21 speeches and 9 letters to different citizens of Ancient Greece.

questions.text: In what country were "The Crystal Stopper" and "La Chute" written?
questions.explanation:
France.

	Maurice Leblanc wrote "The Crystal Stopper" (in English) in 1912. The French translation of this story is "Le Bouchon De Cristal". Albert Camus wrote "La Chute" in 1956.

questions.text: Where did "The Little Orphan" and "Anna Karenina" originate?
questions.explanation:
Russia.

	Fyodor Dostoevksy wrote "The Little Orphan" in 1887. Lev Nikolayevich Tolstoy started writing "Anna Karenina in 1837 and finished writing it in 1877.

questions.text: In what country was the poem "August" by Faiz Ahmed Faiz written?
questions.explanation:
Pakistan.

	Faiz Ahmed Faiz wrote "August" in 1952. Faiz Ahmed Faiz's poetry was expected to follow the dictates of the Socialist Realism just as the other Pakistani poets or writers were.

questions.text: "Ramakian" is an epic poem about Thailand.
questions.explanation:
True.

	"Ramakian" means "Glory of Rama". It is an epic poem about Hanuman's trip to Lanka. There are 212 paragraphs in the poem. The story is barely known in the Western world.

questions.text: "The Divine Comedy" and "Metamorphoses" are stories that were written in what country?
questions.explanation:
Italy.

	Alghieri Dante wrote "The Divine Comedy" in 1313. The story is of two men passing through Purgatory and Ovid wrote a story about humans and gods titled "Metamorphoses" in 8 AD.

questions.text: Where were the stories "Moby Dick" and "The Raven" written?
questions.explanation:
U.S.A.

	Herman Melville wrote "Moby Dick" in 1851 about one man's search for a the whale that maimed him. Edgar Allan Poe wrote a poem properly titled "The Raven" about a raven that enters the home of a lonely man The poem was published in 1845.
